definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Bruni also dives deep to offer some surprises on non-elite public schools.
sentences.chinese: 布魯尼還深入挖掘了一些非名校的公立大學的亮點。

sentences.english: People who get into top colleges have deep interests they love to talk about, maybe a little too much even.
sentences.chinese: 特別是名校的學生，一說到這個甚至會有點感動過甚。

sentences.english: It is very complicated to probe the reason why the western noted universities can keep vigorous.
sentences.chinese: 探究西方名校“活力”之源，是一個非常複雜的問題。

sentences.english: A Beijing native, Ulrich earned an Ivy-studded education in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 身爲北京人的李晶在美國常春藤名校接受過高等教育。

sentences.english: Have fluent English abilities in both speaking and writing.
sentences.chinese: 有名校或者名企背景，英語流利者最佳。

sentences.english: The century-old famous Nankai Middle School of Tianjin is only one hundred steps from the Clothing Street.
sentences.chinese: 百年名校天津南開中學距服裝街僅百步之遙。

sentences.english: Only the Sorbonne district still retains the venerable air of a famous institution.
sentences.chinese: 只有索爾邦校區中，還保留一分古老名校的典雅氣派。

sentences.english: Will you have a better life if you graduate from an elite school?
sentences.chinese: 你從一個名校畢業之後是否就能生活得更好了呢？

sentences.english: He applied for several prodigious universites, and was admitted to Harvard University.
sentences.chinese: 他申請了好幾所名校，結果被哈佛大學錄取。

sentences.english: In one hundred, school experiment elementary school campus of spring.
sentences.chinese: 百年名校閔行實驗小學春城校區。

sentences.english: As a great university with a history longer than 100 years, BNU has extremely demanding standards.
sentences.chinese: 做爲百年名校，北京師範大學有極爲嚴格的標準。

sentences.english: And I want to enter a famous university. But I do not know whether I have the ability to pass.
sentences.chinese: 並且想考一所名校，但不知自己有沒有這個實力。

sentences.english: Respectable, but still far from the Harvards and Oxfords of the world.
sentences.chinese: 還算不錯，但與名校哈佛和牛津仍相去甚遠。

sentences.english: He says he had grown enamored with the 'prestige' of an Ivy League degree.
sentences.chinese: 他說他以前曾經迷戀常春藤名校文憑的“威望”。

sentences.english: The century-old famous Nankai Middle School of Tianjin is only one hundred steps from the shopping center.
sentences.chinese: 百年名校天津南開中學距購物中心僅百步之遙。

sentences.english: Like all highly selective colleges and universities, Haverford places great emphasis on applicants' academic preparation.
sentences.chinese: 跟所有的名校一樣，哈弗福德也很重視學生的成績。

definition: the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to enter the next grade school
universities and colleges/abbr. for 高等學校|高等学校
abbr. for 清華大學|清华大学[Qing1 hua2 Da4 xue2]
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
Peking University (abbr. for 北京大學|北京大学)
